text: Hi, I have a custom module with a card and CTA on it. Right now only the CTA is clickable, does anyone know a way to make the whole card link  to the same place as the CTA link if I for example can target the cta in my <a> tag? would love to have a way without having to put in anothter href  in the <a>

Hi guys, I have to manipulate data that comes from the third party organisation, which is GOTO webinar. Goto webinars are in our case integrated and connected through HubSpot, but I also need to manipulate date and time of the webinar, within code, so does anybody have any clue how to do that, or is that even possible with the third party organisation? Thanks.
Anyone got any examples of some HubSpot cms built sites with really engaging front ends?
What is the data type and the length for Deal ID?
Anyone?^ It seems like it big integer? But on the payload I can see string. A bit confusing.
According to the docs, its a string: <https://developers.HubSpot.de/docs/api/crm/deals>
I could swear I saw integer
I reckon not longer than 32 or 64 chars
Hey everyone, I'm currently trying to get sales analytics for our HubSpot team... does anyone know which route to use with the API?
Hello, I'm trying to change the banner image on a landing page template in the html/css code. I was wondering if anybody had any tips on how to get this done?

<@U03CH5VT2NT> You can copy the card html into the rich-text code-view of the CTA text-area. Maybe you have to add the styling as inline CSS to each element. I would try this, but only on the website. Maybe it will not work for email CTAs and for users with disabled JavaScript. Testing recommend.

Otherwise you need JavaScript with a click event listener on the card element that read the target of the CTA and change the window location for the user. In css you can set the cursor for the card hover to a pointer.

Hi.. I’m trying to get all the data for a specific person via GET method but failed..
Tried below URL’s in the POSTMAN but failed
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?properties=firstname&value=Hassan>```
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/properties?name=firstname&value=Hassan>```
Please assist on this.. Urgent
Note: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
